Posted By: vantha (6/11/2012 3:03:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Paying life to draw cards has already proven to be broken (see [Necropotence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necropotence)). With that card, you get them at the end of your turn. This one is an on demand draw engine, with lifelink and flying and a good body. And with all of the shenanigans black has to avoid paying for creatures, you probably won't need to hard cast it. 5/5
posts.html:
Paying life to draw cards has already proven to be broken (see Necropotence). With that card, you get them at the end of your turn. This one is an on demand draw engine, with lifelink and flying and a good body. And with all of the shenanigans black has to avoid paying for creatures, you probably won't need to hard cast it. 5/5

posts.post_content:
Incredible card. Timmy sees a 7/7 with flying & lifelink. Johnny sees a nice toy for [Liliana](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana) & [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites). Spike sees a [Yawgmoth's Bargain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Bargain) with lifelink that doubles as a finisher.   
  
So many synergies, so little time.  
  
**Block**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Standard**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Extended**: [Fauna Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fauna Shaman) with [Necrotic Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necrotic Ooze)  
**Modern**: [Goryo's Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goryo's Vengeance)  
**Legacy**: [Dread Return](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread Return), [Exhume](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exhume), [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead), [Show and Tell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Show and Tell)  
**Vintage**: [Oath of Druids](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oath of Druids), [Necromancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necromancy), [Dance of the Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dance of the Dead)
posts.html:
Incredible card. Timmy sees a 7/7 with flying & lifelink. Johnny sees a nice toy for Liliana & Unburial Rites. Spike sees a Yawgmoth's Bargain with lifelink that doubles as a finisher.

So many synergies, so little time.

Block: Unburial Rites
Standard: Unburial Rites
Extended: Fauna Shaman with Necrotic Ooze
Modern: Goryo's Vengeance
Legacy: Dread Return, Exhume, Animate Dead, Show and Tell
Vintage: Oath of Druids, Necromancy, Dance of the Dead

Wicked good in EDH commander.

Posted By: Salient (5/28/2012 3:44:58 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Whoa. Griselbrand actually makes a card like [Venser's Journal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Venser's Journal) seem appealing. You pay 7 life to draw 7 cards, then you gain that life back plus whatever other cards you had in your hand and you don't have to discard any of them at the end of your turn? You can essentially be gaining massive card advantage and a lot more life if you play your cards right.

Posted By: MANABURNWASGOOD (6/26/2012 7:26:55 AM)

posts.post_content:
Guy lasted longer in the story than he did in EDH.  
  
Not a very surprising ban though. I knew it was probably coming but I made him my captain since all my friends made decks around the legendary angels from the set. Yeah, once I upped my land count to 40 I never lost a game. The reliability of ramping into this on turn six or so, drawing thirty-five to fifty cards, dropping a [reliquary tower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=reliquary tower), [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves) (Or equivilent) and [Empyrial Plate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Empyrial Plate) and winning instantly was staggering. In the rare event that someone could respond to any of this, you can *still* get the card draw!! It doesn't matter if he is on the bottom of my library.  
  
A couple times I had to wait and win with a massive, ramped up [Exsanguinate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exsanguinate), but that wasn't exactly unreliable. The worst part was that he wasn't *fun*. He would hit the field, and I would spend five minutes drawing cards, then I would play a couple things while m... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Even though I play Drana EDH, I knew to not invest in this. This card was already too good to be true. We all know why Yawgmoth's Bargain is banned over Necropotence, and it certainly follows true here, as well as gives us an unnecessary (but cool) 7/7 flying lifelink trample demon guy.   
  
Yawgmoth's Bargain doesn't gain you life, kill creatures or deal damage (with evasion, mind you). And you expect that we should get this for EIGHT MANA? If this was printed on a 13 mana Eldrazi, it would still be iffy, and maybe banworthy. At 8, you have so much silliness that'll get you up the like Cabal Coffers, Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth, Extraplanar Lens, Gauntlet of Power, Caged Sun, Heartless Summoning and so forth (the intricate stuff like Dark Ritual or Ashnod's Altar don't really always count), you'll be getting this guy out turn 3-6. Or you could Entomb/Exhume it on turn one with a Dark Ritual, however Reanimator tactics generally start turn 2-3 in EDH, so you can feasibly get him out on turn ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

Yawgmoth's Bargain doesn't gain you life, kill creatures or deal damage (with evasion, mind you). And you expect that we should get this for EIGHT MANA? I like to imagine this guy riding into battle atop a [pelakka wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pelakka wurm) for no apparent reason.

posts.post_content:
Has anyone else seen this card show up in some of the newer Reanimator decks in Legacy? Seriously, I wonder why this is becoming a target now.   
  
I think for one thing you could hard cast it. It also negates that reanimate you played. Lifelink is pretty good, but it's ability is not typically what a Reanimator deck wants to do (all Jin-Gitaxas aside).  
  
This guy is blackest thing out there in Standard right now, so I respect it, as he is super bad and epitomizes what I would consider **Suicide-Black**.
posts.html:

I think for one thing you could hard cast it. It also negates that reanimate you played. Lifelink is pretty good, but it's ability is not typically what a Reanimator deck wants to do (all Jin-Gitaxas aside).

This guy is blackest thing out there in Standard right now, so I respect it, as he is super bad and epitomizes what I would consider Suicide-Black.

posts.post_content:
As awesome as Innistrad was overall, I have to say that I really dislike Griselbrand for the way that he ruins EDH games. He should probably be banned from the format. Card draw is really powerful- its part the tripod of brokenness. Massive, repeatable card draw for one player that doesn't cost any mana? That's probably not a good idea, like, ever. And if you look a that with the fact that EDH games last longer and a player has 40 life, and you have a really pain in the ass broken card.   
With Griselbrand as Commander: Throw a bunch of black fast mana cards and mana rocks in your deck, put a [skirge familiar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= skirge familiar), [venser's journal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=venser's journal), [exsanguinate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= exsanguinate), etc. Congratulations, you've just ruined an EDH game.   
 I wish that R & D would think about casual formats (read EDH) when they design emblematic legendary creatures, particularly if they're high CMC. Example of a wonderful emblematic legendary creature in EDH: [Ava](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ava)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
